caseTitle: Dr. Mohammad Aslam Khaki v. Khawja Khalid Farooq Khan and others
tagline: Article 175(2) of the Constitution stipulates that jurisdiction of courts can be conferred either by the Constitution or law. Intra-court appeal is a statutory remedy, and does not take away the appellate jurisdiction of the Supreme Court.  In appropriate cases the Supreme Court will not insist to first avail an intra court appeal.  The National Police Foundation would in certain cases be amenable to High Court’s jurisdiction under Article 199 of the Constitution.  More than a single plot cannot be allotted to an individual.  Parks and green areas cannot be converted to residential use, nor can be alloted.
